page.title: 19Shiskine Primary School
page.content: In Shiskine School there are 47 children. The old part was built in 1865, and what is now the dining/gym hall was one big classroom. In 1900 the porch was built and used as a playroom. Two new classrooms were built in 1967, one now used for the P.5-7 and the other for P.1-2. In 1979 another classroom was built, and is used for P.3-4. There is also a kitchen and a TV room. There is one teacher in each classroom, a cook & assistant, cleaner, and from Aug.'85 an auxiliary/secretary. We play mainly ball games in the playground, dodge ball, netball and football. The favourite game is "kick the can". The object of the game is to free your team mates from the other catchers, and hide.
